mid.trigger: An ally within 30 feet of the anadi fateweaver that they can see makes a skill check or a saving throw
entries: The creature rerolls the triggering check and takes the new result.
mid.name: Fate's Threads

entries: The anadi changes into their hybrid, spider, or human form. The above statistics assume the anadi is in hybrid form. While in human form, the anadi seeker loses their climb Speed and can't use their fangs attack. When in spider form, they can't use weapons.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. An anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.
bot.name: Spin Silk

entries: The anadi changes into their hybrid, spider, or human form. The above statistics assume the anadi is in hybrid form. While in human form, the anadi seeker loses their climb Speed and can't use their fangs attack. When in spider form, they can't use weapons.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The anadi lurker deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to flatfooted creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. An anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.
bot.name: Spin Silk

entries: The anadi changes into their hybrid, spider, or human form. The above statistics assume the anadi is in hybrid form. While in human form, the anadi seeker loses their climb Speed and can't use their fangs attack. When in spider form, they can't use weapons.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. An anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.
bot.name: Spin Silk

entries: The prevalence of insects on the Magaambya campus means Binji is more infested with gremlin lice than most grimples. The Reflex DC to avoid infestation from her gremlin lice is 15 rather than 13.
items.name: So Many Lice

entries: As shieldbearer construct (page 40).
mid.name: Critical Vulnerability

entries: As shieldbearer construct (page 40).
mid.name: Ridden Construct

mid.trigger: An ally within the bramble champion's reach is targeted by an attack, and the bramble champion can see the attacker
entries: The bramble champion interposes with its hammer, giving the ally a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Hammer Block

entries: A giant bee is {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} for 1 round if it starts its turn in heavy smoke.
mid.name: Smoke Susceptibility

mid.trigger: A creature the giant silverfish can see targets it with an attack
entries: The giant silverfish gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the silverfish {@action Step||Steps}.
mid.name: Wriggle

entries: A giant silverfish consumes up to 1 Bulk of paper, cloth, or similar material. It can consume up to 8 Bulk each day.
bot.name: Voracious Consumption

entries: The giant tsetse fly can detect blood within 30 feet. This is a precise sense against creatures within 30 feet that are bleeding.
top.name: Blood Scent

entries: If the fly's last action was a successful proboscis {@action Strike}, it sucks its target's blood. The target takes {@damage 1d4} bleed damage (or {@damage 1d6} bleed damage if the target is an animal).
bot.name: Blood Draw

entries: A giant bee is {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1} for 1 round if it starts its turn in heavy smoke.
mid.name: Smoke Susceptibility

mid.trigger: A creature {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Step||Steps} into {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} adjacent to the gnagrif
entries: The gnagrif gives the ground a hearty pound and it shifts beneath the triggering creature's feet. The triggering creature must succeed on a DC 18 Reflex save or fall {@condition prone}.
mid.name: Soften Stone

entries: The gnagrif gnashes and tears at an object or structure, dealing {@damage 2d4+2} piercing damage and ignoring Hardness 2 or lower.
bot.name: Eat Rocks

bot.requirements: A structure made from stone or earth is within the gnagrif's reach
entries: The gnagrif partially melds with the stone. It {@action Take Cover||Takes Cover} in the stone and makes a {@skill Stealth} check to {@action Hide}.
bot.name: Lurk

entries: A gnagrif ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by rocks or rubble, including squares affected by their Stomp Around.
bot.name: Rubble Stride

entries: The gnagrif huffs and stamps its feet, churning the ground around it. The square it is in and all unoccupied adjacent squares become {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
bot.name: Stomp Around

entries: Whenever two or more gnagrifs use Eat Rocks on the same object or structure, the value of Hardness they can ignore increases by 1 for every gnagrif, to a maximum of Hardness 10.
bot.name: Wrecker

entries: +11, {@skill Thievery} +9 (+11 to {@action Steal}) Str –2, Dex +4, Con +1, Int +1, Wis –1, Cha +3 Items shortbow (60 arrows), shortsword.
top.name: Stealth

entries: Kurshkin redirects the strike to an adjacent creature. The attacker rerolls the {@action Strike} against that creature.
mid.name: Collateral Damage

entries: 20 feet. Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (DC 20 Will save; a creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it remains within the aura's emanation.
mid.name: Unluck Aura

entries: {@damage 1d6+4} piercing Ranged shortbow +12 (deadly <d10>, magical, range increment <60 feet>, reload <0>), Damage {@damage 1d6} piercing Primal Innate Spells DC 20; 2nd speak with animals (at will); 1st gust of wind, spider sting; Cantrips (2nd) prestidigitation.
bot.name: S), Damage

entries: Stabs Kurshkin deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage with her melee {@action Strike||Strikes} against creatures affected by her unluck aura.
bot.name: Lucky

entries: When attacking with a finesse melee weapon, Kurshkin adds her Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of her Strength modifier.
bot.name: Natural Thief

entries: A scrit can consume a book after smearing its pages to absorb its contents (it gains no benefit from consuming a book with pages smeared by another scrit). For 1 day after consuming the book, the scrit can make {@action Recall Knowledge} skill checks on the book's subject with a +4 item bonus, and it can speak and understand the languages the book was written in. If it Eats another Book, it replaces the benefits of the previous Eat Book.
bot.name: Eat Book
Nasty Ink
bot.note: A scrit's fingers are perpetually covered in smeared ink from the writing it's destroyed. This ink mixes with its skin oils to create a disgusting, sticky poison.

entries: The scrit rubs its fingers against one page of writing, smearing the text and rendering it unreadable. The scrit can smear and destroy magical writing such as a glyph of warding or a sigil by succeeding at a counteract check (using the scrit's spell attack modifier) against the caster's DC.
bot.name: Smear Text

entries: A critical hit damages the construct's controls, making it {@condition clumsy|CRB|clumsy 1} until repaired. Additional critical hits increase this value, up to {@condition clumsy|CRB|clumsy 4}.
mid.name: Critical Vulnerability

entries: The construct is piloted by a leaf leshy (Pathfinder Bestiary 218), who can be targeted separately but has greater cover. The leshy can't take actions of their own while inside the construct, other than to leave it, which takes 1 minute.
mid.name: Ridden Construct

entries: As shieldbearer construct (page 40).
mid.name: Critical Vulnerability

entries: As shieldbearer construct (page 40).
mid.name: Ridden Construct

entries: The construct deals an additional {@damage 1d4} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} or {@condition prone} creatures.
bot.name: Menacing Sickles

entries: Each enemy in the silverfish swarm's space takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage (DC 14 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save is {@condition sickened|CRB|sickened 1}.
bot.name: Swarming Bites

entries: A silverfish swarm consumes up to 1 Bulk of paper, cloth, or similar material. It can consume up to 4 Bulk each day.
bot.name: Voracious Consumption

entries: The spellskein can collapse flat to the ground to {@action Hide}; it can attempt to {@action Hide} even if it doesn't have any cover or concealment.
bot.name: Collapse

bot.requirements: The spellskein is folded into its crane shape
entries: The spellskein gains a 25-foot fly Speed until the beginning of its next turn.
bot.name: Crane Glide

bot.requirements: The spellskein is folded into its frog shape
entries: The spellskein Leaps 15 feet horizontally or vertically and gains a 10-foot climb Speed until the beginning of its next turn.
bot.name: Frog Hop

bot.requirements: The spellskein is folded into its lizard shape
entries: The spellskein puffs out its cloth frills and shakes them from side to side to look fierce. The first creature hit by its sharp edge {@action Strike} before the start of its next turn must succeed on a DC 14 Will save or become {@condition frightened|CRB|frightened 1} ({@condition frightened|CRB|frightened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Lizard Frill

entries: The spellskein folds itself into a crane, frog, or lizard shape, as it chooses.
bot.name: Refold

entries: +12, {@skill Nature} +13, {@skill Stealth} +11 Str +3, Dex +0, Con +4, Int +3, Wis +4, Cha +1 Items leather armor, +1 morningstar, sling (10 bullets)
top.name: Magaambya Lore

entries: Ghost can pass through objects made of stone or soil, including walls.
When inside an object, Stone Ghost can't perceive, attack, or interact with anything outside the object, and if he starts his turn inside an object, he is {@condition slowed|CRB|slowed 1}.
mid.name: Stone Spirit Stone

entries: {@damage 1d6+7} bludgeoning Ranged sling +11 (propulsive, range increment <50 feet>, reload <1>), Damage {@damage 1d6+5} bludgeoning Primal Prepared Spells DC 22, attack +14; 3rd earthbind, summon elemental (earth only); 2nd darkvision, glitterdust, shatter; 1st command (animals only), grease, pass without trace; Cantrips (3rd) acid splash, dancing lights, know direction, shield, tanglefoot.
bot.name: P), Damage

bot.requirements: A foe within Stone Ghost's reach is standing on stone or soil
entries: Stone Ghost briefly extends his intangibility to a foe and drags or pounds them into the earth. He makes an {@skill Athletics} check against the target's Fortitude.
bot.name: Entombing Grasp

entries: On a success, the foe is planted waist-deep in the ground and is {@condition immobilized} and {@condition flat-footed} until it Escapes (DC 22). On a critical success, the foe is completely buried and must hold its breath until it is free or else start suffocating. A successful {@action Escape} returns the foe to its original square on the surface, or the closest unoccupied square.
bot.name: DC.

mid.trigger: An ally Takulu can see and who can hear Takulu makes a skill check or an attack roll
entries: Takulu grants the ally a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering check.
mid.name: Quick Lesson

entries: If Umbo is reduced to 0 HP by a critical hit, he pops, forcing him to immediately Emit Spores, even if he has already used the ability that day.
mid.name: Spore Pop

entries: Umbo expels spores in a 10-foot burst centered on a corner of his own space. This cloud lasts until the start of the myceloid's next turn. Each creature that is in the cloud or enters it is exposed to purple pox.
bot.name: Emit Spores

stages.entry: {@damage 4d6} poison damage, {@condition stupefied|CRB|stupefied 3}, and the creature is compelled to seek out the nearest myceloid colony—this compulsion is a mental {@trait emotion} effect

entries: Umbo targets one creature affected by purple pox within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a DC 18 Will save. It is then temporarily immune to spore domination for 10 minutes.

entries.Success: Until the end of its next turn, the target is {@condition helpful} to myceloids and can't take {@condition hostile} actions against them. If attacked by Umbo, the target is freed from this effect at the end of Umbo's turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As success, but until the purple pox is cured.

bot.name: Spore Domination

entries: Urbel's reach leaves a square during its move action; Urbel lashes out at the triggering creature's knees. He attempts an {@skill Acrobatics} check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands {@condition prone}.
mid.name: Kneecapper

entries: Any melee weapon Urbel uses gains the {@trait shove} trait, and if he rolls a critical failure when attempting to {@action Shove} a creature with the weapon, he treats the result as a failure instead.
bot.name: Bully

entries: Urbel's melee {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage to {@condition prone} targets.
bot.name: Pound Down
